intro: Ficus gombariensis, commonly known as the Gombarien fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered fig fruits. It thrives in humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Ficus gombariensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to indoor conditions.
